title: Abbotts Delaunay 2014 Alto Stratus Carignan (Vin de France)
description: This lush, rich bottling leads with abundant oak-derived aromas of sweet spice, pencil shavings, whole vanilla bean and sweet wood. Raspberry sauce, macerated boysenberry and blackberry-coulis fruit tones lend some supporting fruit character. The palate is full and plush, while the woody tannins only come into play on the medium-length finish.

title: Albino Armani 2014 Colle Ara Terradeiforti Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)
description: Gold, with delicate copper highlights—the natural color of Pinot Grigio juice when it has contact with the grape skins—this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and fragrant wild flower. The bright palate offers yellow peach, apple and a note of candied lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.

title: Albino Armani 2014 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of white spring blossom and orchard fruit. The bright, straightforward palate offers Kaiser pear, juicy yellow peach and a lemon zest note alongside vibrant acidity.

title: Anthony Nappa 2014 Fruition Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Intense vanilla and spice tones accentuate the abundance of white blossom and citrus-peel perfume on this heady Viognier. It's richly textured, dense like cream on the midpalate, but elegantly balanced in acidity, finishing with a touch of astringency on the finish.

title: Bedell 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Like many of Bedell's whites, smoky, flinty notes take some aeration to ease off, but with some time, elegant white grapefruit and lemon tones peek out nicely. This light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc is bracingly lemony with a steely, cool backbone of minerality.

title: Belisario 2012 Cambrugiano Riserva  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, white flower and a whiff vanilla lead the way while the medium-bodied palate offers butterscotch, white almond, mineral and candied lemon zest. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness.

title: Benessere 2013 John's Promise Estate Red (St. Helena)
description: This wine has an elusive entry that veers into chalky vanilla and smoky oak. A blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Aglianico, made in small amounts, it has a leanness to the midpalate and a thick, drying finish.

title: Domaine LeSeurre 2014 Dry Cuvée Classique Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Fresh apricot and peach juxtapose more savory tones of bramble and hay in this light-bodied dry Riesling. The palate is briskly concentrated, finishing on a bright streak of sunny tangerine acidity.

title: Domaine LeSeurre 2014 Unoaked Cuvée Classique Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Ripe, rich apricot and peach flavors are accented by touches of bramble and earth in this slightly rustic yet elegant Chardonnay. Tangerine acidity jolts the midpalate, leading a fresh, crisp finish.

title: Emina 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Citrus and green-herb aromas are as they should be for Verdejo. A chunky, slightly oily mouthfeel and pithy, salty flavors of citrus and stone fruits finish round in feel and briny in taste.

title: Fetzer 2013 Valley Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: There's absolutely nothing wrong with this very affordable, concentrated and trimly built wine. Earth and sage aromas lead to bright black cherry and plum flavors, with a typically firm texture for the varietal.

title: Fetzer 2014 Shaly Loam Gewürztraminer (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of orange blossoms, scratched apple skins, lemon-lime soda and jasmine waft off of this bottling. The texture is quite grippy, with tactile acidity and a dynamic mouthfeel presenting lime sorbet and sugared apple flavors.

title: Fattoria Coroncino 2013 Gaiospino  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This unusual, deeply golden colored wine doesn't have a very expressive nose but the round, full-bodied palate offers candied lemon drop and white peach. An almond note closes the finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Forchini 2012 Proprietor's Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A slip of sour cherry gives zing to this medium-acidity, fruit-forward wine that's both earthy and pinched in toasted oak.

title: Marchetti 2014 Tenuta del Cavaliere  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This opens with subdued aromas that recall yellow flower, toasted nut and a whiff of citrus. The rather lean but quenching palate offers lemon zest, white almond and a hint of mineral alongside zesty acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: McManis 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has a strong layer of spicy oak from the first sniff through the lingering finish. Deep, ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors fill in the palate, and the full body of moderate tannins creates a mouthfeel that's plush.

title: Meinklang 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: There are just a few hints of pepper on this crisp, pear-scented dry white. This is made for a party with its light-bodied, easy-drinking style.

title: Morgan 2014 Cotes du Crow's Red (Monterey)
description: One of the Central Coast's best deals each vintage, this blend of 53% Grenache and 47% Syrah shows candied cherries, cinnamon, scarlet red roses, slate and earthy clay notes on the nose. The palate also shows some clay as well as dense boysenberry fruit and touches of lavender and pepper.

title: Steelhead Vineyards 2013 Red (North Coast)
description: This wine is big in flavor, with notes ranging from light herbs to black olives and black cherries, while the firm texture is softened by a suggestion of sweetness. It certainly makes a good alternative to the standard varietals when a full-bodied wine is wanted.

title: Rare 2012 Black Blend Extremely Rare Red (California)
description: This is an elegant, silky-textured wine that doesn't taste as black or bold as the label would suggest. It has medium body, bright fruit flavors and hints of white pepper and white chocolate that accent a core of red cherry and raspberry.

title: Shaw 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Notes of spring blossom and fresh herbs perfume the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is markedly riper, almost ruddy with fleshy yellow peach flavors. Aged one year on the lees, it shows a uniquely textured, mouth-coating feel that lingers on the finish.

title: Peter Cellars 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: An older vintage, this is a soft and malleable wine dusty in tannin and oak, with light-bodied flavors and aromas of blackberry, cherry and chocolate.

title: Peter Cellars 2014 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Dark pink-red in color, this wine has a ripe, sugary nose and a high-octane entry. It grows up to be tangy in citrus peel and fresh grapefruit and cherry, finishing dry.

title: Tertulia 2012 Whistling Hills Estate Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Viognier (10%) announces itself first with aromas of flowers and orange peel that are followed by smoke, leather and spice on a wine that has yet to fully reveal itself. The cranberry and cherry flavors are full in feel, tapering toward the finish.

title: Sea Pearl 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This relatively simple but satisfying wine hits all the basic Sauvignon Blanc notes: Melon, fig, citrus and grassy herbs. It's medium-bodied and boasts a decently long finish, too. Drink now.

title: Stroppiana 2011 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark berry, scorched earth, grilled porcini and a whiff of leather. The palate offers sour cherry, sage and a hint of cured meat alongside raspy tannins that give it a grainy finish.

title: Suavia 2014  Soave Classico
description: Light and vibrant, this opens with delicate scents recalling white flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of almond. The slender palate offers Bartlett pear and citrusy notes alongside racy acidity.

title: Tablelands 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
description: This wine leans toward the vegetal side of Sauvignon Blanc, without ever crossing over into objectionable. In fact, it shows attractive notes of struck flint and snow pea, accompanied by hints of citrus and tomato stalk. It's fresh, clean and would be perfect with a ceviche starter.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Fleshy, generous black cherry fruit swishes across nose and palate. A core of freshness and spice brings a little order into all this fleshiness. This may benefit from being chilled as a full-fruited if medium-bodied summer red.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2014 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Notes of fleshy black cherry dominate. The palate is fresh but lacks a little focus: there is plenty of black cherry fruit playing on the soft, easy palate, untroubled by oak. A very ready, easy picnic wine. Drink soon.
